intro: Geissorhiza unifolia, commonly known as the single-flowered geissorhiza, is a species of flowering plant in the family Iridaceae. It is native to South Africa, where it typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant produces striking, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
